decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Drawing number 2306-001 (Site Location Plan) Dated December 2023  
Drawing number 2306-003 (Existing Site Plan) Dated December 2023
Drawing number: 2306-015 (Proposed Site Location Plan) Dated December 2023
Drawing number: 2306-014 (Proposed Block Plan) Dated December 2023.
Drawing number: 2306-016(Proposed Ground Floor Plan) Dated December 2023
Drawing number 2306-017 (Proposed First Floor Plan) Dated December 2023 
Drawing number: 2306-018(Proposed Second Floor Plan) Dated December 2023
Drawing number: 2306-019(Proposed Roof Plan) Dated December 2023
Drawing number: 2306-020(Proposed Front East Elevation Plan) Dated December 2023
Drawing number: 2306-021 (Proposed South Elevation Plan) Dated December 2023 
Drawing number: 2306-022 (Proposed Rear West Elevation Plan) Dated December 2023 
Drawing number: 2306-023 (Proposed Section A Plan) Dated December 2023
Drawing number: 2306-026(Proposed Volume Calculations) Dated December 2023
Drawing number: 2306-024 (Proposed Section B Plan) Dated December 2023 
Drawing number: 2306-025(Proposed Section C Plan) Dated December 2023
Site Photographs received on Tuesday 03rd September 2024

Condition : 2 - The operations would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - The operations would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 4 - The development is only just within Permitted Development tolerances in terms of volume. You are advised to complete the development in full accordance with the plans, as if the development is larger than that covered by this Certificate a breach of planning control could result.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESEPECT OF THE PROPOSED ENLARGEMENT OF EXISTING ROOF EXTENSION.
